name: Adrian Ehiede
label: Software Engineering Graduate
summary: Enthusiastic software engineering graduate skilled in testing, developing software, and IT support. Strong analytical and communication abilities, thrives in high-pressure environments, and eager to tackle new challenges while learning and growing.

work_experience.summary: Worked on a team to develop a web application using React and Node.js, participated in daily stand-ups, code reviews, and sprint planning sessions, and gained experience in Agile methodologies and version control with Git.
highlights: Collaborated with a team of 5 interns to develop a web application using React and Node.js
Participated in daily stand-ups, code reviews, and sprint planning sessions
Gained experience in Agile methodologies and version control with Git

work_experience.summary: Coordinated project activities, managed timelines, and communicated with stakeholders to ensure successful project delivery within scope, time, and budget constraints.
highlights: Coordinated project activities and managed timelines to ensure successful project delivery
Communicated with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide updates on project progress
Monitored project budgets and ensured that projects were delivered within scope, time, and budget constraints

work_experience.summary: Led a team of five to advise on defense diving standards, coordinated with internal and external personnel, and presented solutions to senior staff for implementation.
highlights: Managing and leading a team of 5 to advise the Defence Diving Standards Team and The Military Diving Capability Cell on assessing and proposing a solution for a provided problem statement
Arranging regular communications with personnel across the DDST, MOD and external organisations to gather problem-relevant contextual information.
Presenting the solution to the commanding staff of the organisation for their understanding and onboarding of the proposal

projects.title: Mobile App for University Students
projects.summary: Designed the frontend of a mobile app for the University of Portsmouths Student View System using Frontend tools such as Figma
highlights: Interviewed students to gather requirements and understand their needs for the app
Created wireframes and prototypes using Figma to visualize the app's design and functionality
Conducted usability testing with students to gather feedback and make improvements to the app's design

images.caption: All frames designed in Figma and their connections

projects.title: Robotics
projects.summary: Built and programmed a robot that uses sensors to pick a coffe mug, avoid obstacles and return to its starting position using CoppeliaSim and Python
highlights: Designed and built a robot using CoppeliaSim that can navigate its environment and perform tasks
Programmed the robot using Python to control its movements and actions
Tested and refined the robot's performance to ensure it can successfully pick up a coffee mug, avoid obstacles, and return to its starting position

degrees: Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering

interests.summary: Favourite books as of right now are A Song of Ice and Fire series by George R.R. Martin
